articles.headline: India Worries as China Builds Ports in South Asia
articles.snippet: As trade in the region grows more lucrative, China is developing more ports and forcing India to rethink relations with its neighbors.
articles.abstract: As trade in the region grows more lucrative, China is developing more ports and forcing India to rethink relations with its neighbors.
articles.lead_paragraph: HAMBANTOTA, Sri Lanka  For years, ships from other countries, laden with oil, machinery, clothes and cargo, sped past this small town near India as part of the world’s brisk trade with China.

articles.headline: Struggling Over a Rule for Brokers
articles.snippet: A piece of the financial overhaul legislation targets the responsibility of stock and insurance brokers to act in their customers’ best interest.
articles.abstract: A piece of the financial overhaul legislation targets the responsibility of stock and insurance brokers to act in their customers’ best interest.
articles.lead_paragraph: While most of the debate about financial overhaul legislation has focused on the impact on how big banks do business, one piece that would affect consumers directly has received little public notice: a requirement that stock and insurance brokers act in their customers’ best interest.

articles.headline: Secret Joint Raid Captures Taliban’s Top Commander
articles.snippet: Pakistani and American intelligence forces captured Mullah Abdul Ghani Baradar, the most significant Taliban figure to be detained in the war in Afghanistan, officials said.
articles.abstract: Pakistani and American intelligence forces captured Mullah Abdul Ghani Baradar, the most significant Taliban figure to be detained in the war in Afghanistan, officials said.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Taliban’s top military commander was captured several days ago in Karachi, Pakistan, in a secret joint operation by Pakistani and American intelligence forces, according to American government officials.
articles.byline: By Mark Mazzetti and Dexter Filkins

articles.headline: Democrats Reel as Senator Says No to 3rd Term
articles.snippet: Senator Evan Bayh’s decision not to seek a third term gives Republicans a new chance to pick up a seat and Democrats fresh anxiety about losing the party’s center.
articles.abstract: Senator Evan Bayh’s decision not to seek a third term gives Republicans a new chance to pick up a seat and Democrats fresh anxiety about losing the party’s center.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Senator Evan Bayh of Indiana announced on Monday that he would not seek re-election, sending a wave of distress over his fellow Democrats and focusing new attention on the view that unyielding partisanship had left Congress all but paralyzed.

articles.headline: A Hand in a House of Cards
articles.snippet: The failed legal pursuit of some intrepid investors is a lesson in how difficult it will be for those trying to punish ratings agencies, which played key roles in the financial crisis.
articles.abstract: The failed legal pursuit of some intrepid investors is a lesson in how difficult it will be for those trying to punish ratings agencies, which played key roles in the financial crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: With all the hand-wringing over the role of Wall Street banks in the financial crisis, one group of key players in the mess has been keeping  and undoubtedly enjoying  a relatively low profile: the rating agencies.

articles.headline: Drug Firms Apply Brand to Generics
articles.snippet: Drug makers are pursuing a consumer base in markets like Asia and Latin America, where many pay out of pocket for medicines but often cannot afford expensive brand-name drugs.
articles.abstract: Drug makers are pursuing a consumer base in markets like Asia and Latin America, where many pay out of pocket for medicines but often cannot afford expensive brand-name drugs.
articles.lead_paragraph: Some prestigious brand-name pharmaceutical companies that once looked askance at the high-volume, low-cost business of generic drugs are now becoming major purveyors of generic medicines.

articles.headline: Tea Party Lights Fuse for Rebellion on Right
articles.snippet: More than populism, the movement is about a transformation from political indifference to bracing for tyranny.
articles.abstract: More than populism, the movement is about a transformation from political indifference to bracing for tyranny.
articles.lead_paragraph: SANDPOINT, Idaho  Pam Stout has not always lived in fear of her government. She remembers her years working in federal housing programs, watching government lift struggling families with job training and education. She beams at the memory of helping a Vietnamese woman get into junior college.
